name: Caribe Club Princess Beach Resort & Spa

reviews.text: I am writing this review a couple years too late!! I have nooooo idea where all these bad reviews are coming from we stayed here with another couple from Nov 1-8/05 and had a blast!! The food was good a great selection and you have to use the a lacarte included in your visit the only one not so great was the mexican restaurant, the others were great and the crepe restaraunt which unfortunately we did not find until the day we were leaving was incredible!!!
reviews.title: Loved This Place!!!
Mixed Review
reviews.text: The beach was great, the pool was well kept and clean. We would see the pool maintenance cleaning in the wee hours of the morning. The beach grill and bar was fantastic nothing but great service, the only thing that was hard is to get a bottle of beer on the beach but what the heck after some persitance and tipping they managed to keep the beach bar stocked with bottles for us. Anyways we have been to Puerta Vallarta, Varadero, Cozumel etc. and I always refer bak to the Princess Caribe in Punta Cana as the best resort we had stayed at, the service was FANTASTIC!!! The monster truck tour was great definately recomend this one(very long day though) also went on a snorkel tour and swam with the sharks another great trip! (dog sharks) Hope this helps!

This is a VERY late review, I went in April 2007. Just wanted to add my two cents to the mix. As someone who has been to Punta Cana twice and also to Cuba, and someone who is not fussy, this was a nice place but probably the worst resort I have stayed at. Why? The staff!! Nice at first, but LOOK OUT! Two ladies we knew were robbed by their maids.
reviews.title: Great Resort! The Perfect Vacation!
Paradise!
reviews.text: Another woman was nice to a guy all week, tipped him etc..., and then when she asked if he could get her some bags of coffee beans he took advantage of her and majorly ripped the poor lady off. Tripled the price, like - what a sleezeball. My friends and I befriended a guy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: named Carlos at "The Creperie" who was sweet, and then within a few days became super nasty when my friends and I turned down his advances...I actually think he spit in my crepe, made us feel really uncomfortable and laughed and spoke Spanish to his buddies and pointed
reviews.title: Satisfied with the CCP experience

likes.disliked: — The two days a week they allowed vendors to set up on-site

reviews.title: Definite no go!!!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.text: Stay away from here. Terrible food and service. Yes, the beach is beautiful, but you get what you pay for................

reviews.title: Beautiful scenery
reviews.text: Not more than a 3 star resort..........

reviews.title: Great place for the family
reviews.text: Sorry.

I Have to say the scenery at this hotel was beautiful. I don't want to discourage anyone who has booked a trip there already. i only had a problem with the food. it looked good and tasted good, but i had stomach problems. the bars were ok. every drink tasted different. they do not use premium liquor, so if your looking for that....you better get VIP, and then only at the main lobby bar can you get premium. My travel agent advised against me getting VIP, and i am sorry i didint get it. The pool and the beach were very beautiful. This is a great place to bring small children, but there really isnt any thing for teens( 10-15) to do. I didint see any bugs at all. the rooms were very clean and so were the grounds. Rooms service was always prompt. Most of the people are pleasant, but some are not. you need to brush up on your spanish. When you arrive at the airport.. be prepares to fill out a green card and pay 10.00 to enter the country. the green cards are located in the center of the lobby when you get off the plane. use the bell boys at the airport, they are very helpful and make sure you tip them. they appreicate the tip, not like the pool bartenders. tip the lobby bar tenders and the food servers, they appreciate it. as far as the maids, well....i tipped them every day and didint get what i asked for, my daughters never tipped and got anything they wanted. it really was beautiful though.
reviews.title: waste of time and money
SUCKED
reviews.text: My family and friends just returned from Caribe Club Princess after a week there (Jul 31-Aug 7). We had a wonderful time. The property is well maintained at all times and offers a great variety of pools, activities, food, and bars to meet the needs of most anyone. For the price, $2880 for air and hotel, for the week for 2 adults and 2 kids with the VIP upgrade was an excellent deal. Had I spent $5000, I might not have been as happy. The staff as a whole was very friendly and helpful. The VIP upgrade is an absolute MUST! It pays for itself more than once and it greatly improves the service and attention received by the guest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned on 6/9/07 from a one week stay, 5 nights of which we were barely able to get 3-4 hours sleep. Our first day was absolutely lovely, great staff, ala carte restaurants, sandy beach, nice pools. The second day the nicety ended and the ugliness began when a huge group of high school seniors from Puerto Rico arrived. They were promised a party week which they got and we lost all possibility of a resonable night's sleep. The property has a disco and when the kids left the disco between 3-4am, it was rampage of the spring break Cancun variety. The kids were yelling and whistling in the halls, banging on doors, misdialing phones (we got 2 phone calls at around 4am). If it were not for the loud laughing I would have been fearful that we were in a riot situation. The total lack of management was apparent when there were at least 75 kids in and around the pool at 4am, of course yelling and splashing in a pool that is closed after 7pm. I assume 4am use of the pool is OK if you are promised a party week.
reviews.title: Very poorly managed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then the situation got worse. I got a room change only to find out that night I was now surrounded by the party week kids. A Polite request to the kids across the room from us to close their door while 8 of them were partying was replied to by "that's your problem, not mine", at that point we felt threatened and backed away. After numerous complaints the Apple rep. said the Guest Services Manager would be in touch with me. Not only did she not contact me, I could not track her down. The long & the short of the whole situation was that mangement chose to suspend and not enforce basic hotel rules. The rank & file staff were at the top of their game. We witnessed waiters escorting kids out of the buffet restaurant who felt sandy wet bathing suits & bare feet were acceptable dress at the dinner hour.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful!

likes.disliked: — Accommodations were fine, bartering was horrible!

reviews.title: A Relaxing Holiday
reviews.text: We travel often and this is was our 3rd trip to the DR. We have never written a negative review or traveler warning, but this needs to be said. Oh, witnessing Pam & Joe's renewal of their wedding vows was a positive highlight of the week.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I will start by saying please ignore the bad reviews. We were slightly concerned with recent negative reviews; however, in the back of our mind we knew it would be what we made of it. We had a fantastic time. Everything was perfect, no complaints. We stayed at Caribe Club Princess from May 19-26. We booked our hotel stay through TNT Vacations and our flight direct through USAir.
reviews.title: Loved the island and the resort!!

likes.liked: — The landscape was amazing from the tropical plants to the beach!
likes.disliked: — the main buffet was not airconditioned.

reviews.text: FLIGHT DOWN:
reviews.title: If only they had better food!
Great time
reviews.text: My first trip to the Carribean and I must say it was EXCELLENT!!! I definitely recommend this resort to everyone going to Punta Cana. You won't get a better beach anywhere in Punta Cana. The food was excellent, with choices ranging from fries, burgers and pizza at the lowest to exotic seafood specialties and caribbean kitchen. Lots and lots of different refreshing drinks and don't forget to try "Presidente", Dominican top beer brand (better than Heineken Coronna and Stella put together, mark my words!). Weather was excellent, sunny, not too humid and the sea was not the boring calm water. We had small fun waves all week long.

reviews.title: Spend quality time with your family!
reviews.text: Cheers,

HOLA! Just came back today from the resort and wanted to give my two cents worth. I traveled with my husband and three teens (17,13 & 13) from the 23rd till the 29th and I must say we had the best vacation ever! Sure there is going to be slight problems with the langage barrier but you will have that in any country you visit. The staff was VERY friendly (especially FABIO at the pool bar) and did their very best to accomidate our needs. The buffet was OK (go for the specialty resturants if you can, but make sure gentlemen have long pants with them because you will not be seated!). You will need to get to the concierage desk in your building by 8:00 am to wait in line to make a reservation for the speciality resturants. You will also need to get to the pool or beach by 7:00-7:30 am to reserve lounge chairs under a hut (believe me you will need that hut for the shade!) even though they say no reserving is permitted. Our suite (2 full beds and pull out couch) was clean, plently of fresh towels twice daily, 2 robes and slippers to use during the stay. The only problem with the room was the air conditioning was not cool enough. We had a problem on the second night with our door key and we called for an hour and a half before we approched management who had fixed the problem while we were at dinner. Listen if you are expecting a 5 star resort it's not. If you want a fun place to go and spend quality time with your family try it. We had the time of our life!
reviews.title: Leaves a lot to be desired

reviews.text: I was here 7/20/- 7/27/05. The trip to Punta Cana was fine. We entered the hotel lobby and thats when all heck broke loose. We had the VIP package and that was our first mistake. We checked in a 1:00 p.m. The front desk said our room would be available after 3:00 p.m.. No problem or so I thought. At 3:30 we went back to hte front counter and tried to get a room. Thats when the staff looks at you kinda wierd and disappears in the back room for about 30 minutes, then return to tell you that in still not available. I came to find out that people had been there since 10:00 a.m. and still had no rooms. They were from the New York area. At approx. 6:00 p.m. there was a room available. Dont be suckered in by the superior rooms they talk about, these are just a regular room with two beds. Not much better than a cheap hotel room back here in the states. I was told that the room had a pullout couch so one of my children could sleep on that. Low and behold, we walked in and no couch. I went back to the front desk and spoke with the clerk who all of a sudden didnt understand English. It was so funny because when hear you are from the USA they start talking in Spanish not knowing that some of us spoke Spanish quite fluently. The things they said about us leaves a lot to be desired. And the faces they made when after their conversation you responded in Spanish was to die for.
reviews.title: Didn't feel like a princess
it was so-so
reviews.text: I remember something my grandfather taught me and should have lsitened again to him. He said "Something good aint cheap and something cheap ain't good" Man was he right. Please, Please spend a few extra dollors and stay in a nicer hotel, where the staff at least speaks a little english. Everyone and I mean everyone has their hand out for a tip, good service or not. ITs a shame that to get into the fancier restaurant that you have to wait everyday at 9:00 a.m. to make the reservation. This can take at least an hour every day. I dont know about you but I want to relax on vacation, not wait in line to make a reservatio only to be told that the restaurant I want is full that night. P.S. Slip the guy a $10.00 and he will get you a reservation. This is ALL INCLUSIVE? NO money no reservation. What you have read about premium liquor in other reviews is true. This option is a joke. The only place you might, get a top shelf drink is in the lobby. Don't expect this in any other area. I was drinking whiskey and water and was told they ran out of whiskey at every bar around the pool area. Really, I dont drink that much.

reviews.title: Great Holiday
reviews.text: After reading all the negative reviews and having stayed at a 5 star hotel in Mexico previously, I wanted to add a quick review of our stay.

reviews.title: Horrible service
reviews.text: My family and friends just returned from a 7 day stay at this hotel. My nephew was married at the resort during our stay. Our party had a fantastic time. We would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to have lots of fun around the pool and can't afford a high end hotel.

reviews.title: great holiday
reviews.text: We did not take the VIP upgrade on this trip as it has not been worth the extra money at other resorts we have stayed at. But you definitely should take it at this resort if you can afford it. Some of our family members did have it and I counted at least 15 improvements that we did not have.

reviews.title: no way it is 4 star
reviews.text: Generally the VIP rooms have newer furniture, whiter towels, better stocked refrigerators and other various things. VIP also includes rum, cigars, two 20 min. massages, free water sports, and the list continues. All VIP rooms are in one building.

reviews.title: Had a great time
reviews.text: Our building, across the pool, was all non-VIP rooms. The furniture was a little shabbier, the towels grayer, only water and pop in the frig. And to be frank, our room was musty smelling. But the rooms of other family members in our group, were fine. It didn't matter as we were there to be by the pool and the beach and didn't spend much time in our room.

reviews.title: Loved It!!!
reviews.text: I stayed here for 7 nights and it was great. (10/14-10/21/07) Everyone was so courteous and pleasant. The weather was great. There were problems with the hand towels, but I brought my own after I read other comments before I traveled. I only experienced that problem two out of the seven days. No big deal since I planned accordingly.

reviews.title: Great Value at a Great Resort
reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious. The view was good. If you are looking for peace and quiet, this is not the resort. I didn't mind the noise because it was calm from 6:00pm - 10:00am. I would recommend this resort and I will return. The staff does its best to ensure that you have a good time if that's what you are seeking. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Great Hotel For The Price
reviews.text: I just returned from the Caribe Club Princess, our 9th stay in Punta Cana. We have stayed high end (Riu Palace Punta Cana, Secrets) middle (Iberostar Punta Cana and Hacienda Dominicus, Sunscape the Beach and the Grand, Riu Bambu, Melia Caribe)...I had a group of 23 with me. This was the only 4 Apple in the Dominican we have visited. Having sold it many time and having had happy clients I was not worried., even with a few bad reviews.

reviews.title: Loved everything about it!
reviews.text: All I can say is I had 23 happy clients with me even with Tropical Storm Noel at our resort the first few days. This resort had quite possible the nicest and most accomdating employees I have ever dealt this!! The staff is wonderful and people make the place! A nice resort with unhappy and unhelpful staff does not cut it with me!

reviews.title: avery & rochelle love love love caribe club princess punta cana
reviews.text: Rooms were fine, clean and nice, and very spacious.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Princess Caribe Dec. 31/06 thru Jan. 07/07. As a well traveled couple we both conclude this was by far the worst resort we have ever had the misfortune of staying at.
reviews.title: Buyer BEWARE

reviews.text: Punta Cana is a beautiful beach, one of the best I have seen in my travels, but the Caribe Princess Resort's food, service and most of the staff made it a very ugly week.
reviews.title: Nice Place, but it needs something.

likes.disliked: — Little Dominican entertainment. Lip synching. Restaurants. Lack of resonably priced child friendly outings.

reviews.text: Firstly I noticed that on many occasions the staff seemed to ignore female concerns in restaurants, room service, or at the front desk but yet seem to act when a male requested the same service.
reviews.title: Awsome!!!

likes.liked: — The beach, food, the way the resort looked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was horrible. Almost all the meat we had was under-cooked and when we asked to cook it longer, it always took a couple dollar tip to get results. The restaurants were always fully booked yet always half empty.
reviews.title: Fabulous Vacation!

likes.disliked: — rude tourists that saved chairs at the pool and beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was always complaining how bad their working conditions were and their service reflected their lack of ambition to serve their customers. They always had their hand out but rarely justified the tip other than claiming poverty.
reviews.title: Great Time in Dominican

reviews.text: I am a high traveler and not much of a complainer, but I think it is my responsibility to warn you and avoid you the problems of choosing such a poor, yet expensive resort.
reviews.title: Horrible! (Terrible!) DO NOT GO THERE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were a total of 5 families traveling together (our first vacation together as group) so we had very high expectations and were looking forward to a relaxed 5 days. Little did we know what we were getting ourselves into.
reviews.title: Not a very good experience from a 4+ Start Resort.

likes.liked: — Beautiful looking gardens, good food, good beach

reviews.text: Here are things to expect:
reviews.title: Stay Away!! The worst resort I have ever been to!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No towels! If you are lucky enough to have towels, you’ll probably not want to use them!
reviews.title: Relaxing beach vacation

likes.disliked: — bring everything - sunscreen, big repellent, aloe, chap stick, its all too expensive there..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No beach towels, even if you get there by 9:00 a.m.
reviews.title: Beach was Great
Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: We just returned from our stay at Caribe Club last night! We took another couple who have been at 4 other resorts in DR last 4 years. Loved the room right by the pool and just steps from the beach! Loved Mamma Mia, the Italian restaurant, and the Asian restaurant! Both great! Loved the concierge who can book your dinners every morning at your building. Excellent employees who always smile. Won some money at the casino too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did get many mosquito bites though, they were fogging the grounds at night. Didn't get any last year. The in-room safes are broken and need repair. The patio doors on ground floor need some lock repair. However, the rooms are very clean, a little dated, but it does not change the beauty of the beach, the ocean and the experience. The food was better than last year. We took tours and rented jet skis and had a ball! We will be back next Feb. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: loved caribe
Paradise
reviews.text: Loved the Caribe stayed there from 2/5/8 to 2/15/8. Glad I ignored the negative reviews. We did VIP suggest that for anyone going to the resort it is worth the few extra dollars.
Our room was spacious and having the additional sitting area was a plus our room overlooked the pool and could see the ocean from our balcony.
reviews.title: Loooved it!!

reviews.text: No problem with the food people have to understand that they are in another country so the style of cooking will be different and they will offer different forms of food, try them they are pretty good.
reviews.title: Had a great time at Caribe Club Princess.

reviews.text: I went to Caribe Club from September 30 to October 14 to celebrate my 21 birthday. It was the best place I have stayed at. When we first arrived Air Canada had booked us to be there in July not September so there was some confusion but they got us some drinks and said no problem you will have a room. The rooms, resort grounds, eating areas and beach were clean and marvelous. The food was great and there was always lots to choose from. Just try not to eat to late so the food is still real fresh. The animation crew was excellent and loves to get you involved. Take the dance lessons as you will be dancing alot in the Dominican. The animation crew was fun, respectful and always made my day great. There is always something to take part in. The shows at night are a once in a life time sight to see. They were so spectacular and amazing costumes. I wouldn't suggest missing a single one. The beach bar is open with drinks all night, although most people would be at the disco or somewhere else. After the show they have a dance and drinks in the main lobby and it is fun. They really appreciate you getting up to dance with them and other people. At around 12 some of them go to the disco and some just stay at the resort. The resort and the time I have had in the Dominican has made a great impresion for me and I can't wait to go back. I will stay at the same place. As resort is not to big and not to small but perfect in everyway!!!
reviews.title: Fabulos, can't wait to return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: MIss everyone lots, Raelee
reviews.title: Going back, for 2 weeks this time
Good Honeymoon
reviews.text: We had such a great time for one week in April 2005 we are returning for a 2 week stay. Beach was wonderful, staff talented, friendly, motivating. Food was great no complaints. My cousin and her family have also been to the resort - twice. :o)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent our honeymoon at the Caribe Club princess. We arrived Sept 11 and stayed until Sept 18.
reviews.title: The best
Caribe Princess Paradise !!
reviews.text: Lobby: Wonderful and beautiful lobby to hang out in. A nice bar and cocktail tables are located in the lobby along with couches and tables. We spent every night hanging out in the open air lobby watching the dancing and activities that would take place there. Great hang out spot!

My friend and I stayed at this resort from dec10/06 to dec 17/06 and we had a blast. We mostly stayed at the pool but we spent one morning at the beach which was fun with the waves.(just hold on to your bathing suit) Our room was clean, no problems with air condioner, buffet was good although by the end of the week I was tired of it. It is a lot of the same stuff everyday but not a big deal. We ate at the mexican twice it was great and brazilian once and left half way through it was taking a long time to bing everything out and we weren't that hungry anyway. We did 2 day trips. We did the saona island which I would not recommend. It started at 0630 in the lobby then 2.5hr bus to the boat then 2 hr on the boat to the island. While at the island you are constantly harrassed by people trying to sell you things. Then it took 1hr back to bus by speedboat then back on the bus for another 2.5hr. When we got back we were so tired we went to bed. The other one was the shopping tour which was excellant for only $22. They take you to the rum factory and show you where to buy things so you won't get ripped off. My tips if you go to this place: bring bug spray, your own facecloth(they don't supply them) and remember if you go looking for faults you are going to find them but this place is great I will definatly go here again.
reviews.title: Best Time Ever

likes.disliked: — there was a bad smell outside sometimes

reviews.text: Been there with my family of four. From the very beginning we felt welcome. The receptionist was kind and tried to accomodate us as quickly and good as possible. The room was what we expected, with the air conditioning in good condition (and not loud), thoroughly cleaned every day. The resort has three pools (all nice) so there was no way one couldn't find where to put down the towel. The beach was great (you'd expect that in Punta Cana!) and the ocean was clean and wavy, so 90% of the time we spent at the ocean.
reviews.title: Excellent value
Awesome Vacation
reviews.text: The personnel was professional and courteous. To those guys complaining about the fact that not everybody speaks great English: what if the Spaniards visiting your country would be annoyed at your lack of Spannish knowledge?!?! Be decent, because anyhow they understand more English than we understand Spannish! The service was great, with or without tips (mind you, I always like to tip them). Talking to other tourists (many Europeans and hardly, if any, Americans) and they were all enjoying their vacation. The a la carte restaurants were okay, with a little plus for the Italian. The Chinese was great once, but not so good the second time (we learned the chef took a few days off, so the replacement cook wasn't as...Chinese). Overall we had a vacation worth more than what we paid for (it was the third cheapest out of about 100 packages!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely people the Dominicans!
reviews.title: Just OK...disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me start off by saying that I have been reading reviews on this website 2
reviews.title: great vacation at ccp

reviews.text: My family and I just came back from this resort. We loved it.
reviews.title: Wow, wow, wow!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Our three teenagers just had a blast. While they were involved in many activities, my husband and I sat by the pool or just sat under a palapa on the beach with a nice cold drink in our hands.
reviews.title: ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL IN EVERY WAY!
Incredible!
reviews.text: I will have to say, that this has been one of the best vacations ever.

reviews.title: Pleasant, Enjoyable, Relaxing Vacation
reviews.text: Other than not getting two adjoining rooms as we had requested, everything was just great.

reviews.title: Great Resort - Worth the Ordeal of Getting to it!
reviews.text: The food, service, entertainment, drinks, rooms, and the entire resort were all great. No complaints.

reviews.title: Loved it!!!! Absolutely Fantastic
reviews.text: My friends and I went the first week of august with air transat and I can honnestly say that it was a perfect vacation from the beginning to end. I loved that resort, everything about it. First of my vacation was so unexpected I never wanted to go in the first place to Punt cana but my friends really wanted to and then why not after all a week of relaxation and beautiful beach. I had the best time and I would so go back there, it definitely is a 4 +star resort. First it's a huge resort and we were well located. When we got there, I told the guy at teh desk that I wanted to be well centered in the middle of everything and he did. We were in the third building which is perfect 2 sec from the swim up bar pool and beach and right in across the buffet. BTW, when we reserved it says that this hotel has 1 pool, nope there are 4 pools I don't know why it said that. The best pool is the one with the swim up bar because all the animation and all the fun is there. Beautiful pool perfect water and very clean. The people there are constantly working to keep everything intact and perfect.

The location is beautiful with its gorgeous vegetation and amazing weather, not one day it rained. Now, I have to say that normally I never really pay attention to the animation but this rseort no wonder it is known for that, AMAZING animation. The people there are awesome super nice and there is so much animation from early the morning till late at night. I loved their theme song that played everyday at the pool and people dancing salsa to it. We would get up early tan at the pool watch the animation a little-take a drink and then afterwards to the beach since it's right there and then go back at the pool. You have the choice to have fun with them at the pool or relax at the beach. BTW Chopel Israel you rock man! I really was sad to leave I had so much fun with the people that worked over there as well as the people that come from different countries to work there such as Italie, France and others so overally there was an excellent blend of different people. I made so many new friends. Now there are many different restaurants and 1 great huge buffet. I loved the buffet there was everything
reviews.title: Our Family Had A Great Time
Great stay
reviews.text: for every taste, I'll be honest I tried only 2 restaurants, they were not bad at all. Loved the creperie amazing we would all go there during the middle of the day and order different crepes delicious. I would always try to eat well because I was scared to get stomache ache which I didn't get the whole trip fewww. Although I did eat a lot, but not eating too much meat, more salads with pizza fish rice etc. At night, there are a lot of shows and then we would go at the club. I can honnestly say that I had an amazing time with my friends and with my new friends. I so did not expect all of this; I really thought it'd be maybe boring vacation was so wrong. I relaxed while enjoying myself. If anyone wonder this hotel is really for everyone. There were families with their grown up children, young and old couples everything. Before I left i was scare that there would only be families or grown ups not at all, we were all around the age of 22- 28 and there were a lot of people around our age, it was a blast, I'll never forget this vacation. There are also a couple of shops close to the hotel, btw I would recommend this hotel because we would always walk on the beach and this hotel is really well center, some hotels are really far from everything. I will definitely go back there again very soon. For anyone who is going try to go when it's really happening probably july, august or the winter that's when it's really fun and animated. I'll never forget my vacation, FANTASTIC HOTEL , I'm not surprise all the princess hotels are amazing and I've travelled a lot!

Our family of 4 stayed at the Caribe Club Princess August 3 - August 10, 2005. My husband and I are in our 30's and we have two boys ages 8 and 11. We had a wonderful time in Punta Cana and thought the Caribe Club Princess hotel was great.
reviews.title: 4 star is accurate

reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, we were able to check in immediately and went to our room. Our luggage arrived within 10 - 15 minutes. We had the Caribe Suite which had 2 double beds and a sofa that was actually a 3rd bed.
reviews.title: If you want this ocean, stay in the states

reviews.text: 11 of us stayed at Club Princess Nov 26 to Dec 3rd, we all had a great time!! This hotel is rated a 4 star, I don't know why, it was beautiful, our room was really nice, the grounds were just gorgeous, the staff work so hard to please everyone, alot of activities during the day and the beach was breath-taking. I know this hotel is an all-inclusive, but we did tip the staff and the maid, they so appreciate it, when you see how these people live outside of the resort it is so sad, it really makes you realize how lucky we are!! I also brought a suitcase with toys and gave them out to the dominican children when we went out on the excursions, it was a christmas for them, be careful if you do this, when you give to one child, you are swormed by so many others. As far as the excursions, the Safari trip 1/2 day was alot of fun, you visit a dominican family home and see how they live and you also get to see thier culture, I really liked this trip and would probably do a full day next time, we also did the speed-boat/snorkeling excursion, this wasn't for me but everyone who went loved it, the dune buggy excursion was alot of fun, if you do this one, wear something dark, you will be full of mud, what a blast though. There is flea-markets on the beach, but a little bit of a walk, I went to the one on the left, it was probably a 15 minute walk, you can find great gifts to take back home, but bargin with these people, they start out really high in price. My friends also went to the one on the right, they said it was a really long walk and it sounds like they have the same stuff. The beach was so pretty, we never had any trouble finding a seat. The weather was beautiful, about 85 and sunny, it rained at night so it really didn't affect us, the last day we were there it started out really cloudy, this was the day I got the most sunburn though, be carefull, the sun is strong. The food was very good, a large selection, the Chinese and Italian restaurants were the best, the buffet was also very good. We only went to one show, they do the shows in four different languages, so everytime they speak it is long, it was funny though. Be carefull, don't drink the water, one of our friends got very very sick. I have been to Mexico, Rivera Maya twice and loved it, but the beaches in the dominican are nicer. We booked our trip thru Apple Vacations for a great price and all had a great time, we would definetely come back to this hotel, when I read some of the reviews, I was scared, don't be, you will be amazed how nice it is. Have a geat trip!!!
reviews.title: What a Blast!!

likes.liked: — Restaurants & Beach were close to Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: after reading some of the negitive reviews i was very worried that my stay at the Caribe Princess would be terrible, but it was honestly the best resort ive ever stayed at. I travel a lot and have been to the DR before but i stayed in the Melia which is raved about. I thought that the Caribe was actually nice than the melia, and the staff was much nicer. Its not true that no one speaks english, i had no problem communicating with anyone. We had the perfect room, 2108 right on the water and right by the main pool. Be aware of the pool bartender he constantly makes you takes shots of mamajuana and its the worst hang over ever the next day. The food was amazing, the chinese was our favorite and the fried ice cream was to die for. The mexican was also delicious. The brazillian was disgusting, we actually got up and left to go to the buffet. The buffet was amazing, everyday we had breakfast and lunch there and we were always taken care of by the staff. The maids will leave you beer in your hotel fridge if you leave them a tip, and they are very appreciative. The casino is very fun and there is a train that comes every 20 minutes to pick you up from the hotel and takes you back to the hotel. I never felt unsafe. The only downfall was the pools, they were always cold because they were not heated. We went snorkeling and that was beautiful, one of the best snorkeling adventures ive ever been on. BRING BUG SPRAY i got eaten up by mosquitos but they dont bug you when you wear bug spray. We always got a chair by the beach but it was a little tougher at the main pool to get a good spot. I would highly recomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a relaxing, fun vacation.
reviews.title: best vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: for this price point (very inexpensive) , the food, accomodation and staff are all above expectation. The main pool area is very noisy due to the incessant "actividades" but there are two smaller pools that are much quieter. There are 7 restaurants with surprising variability in the food. They do use too much salt. For meat eaters, goat is served at a few of the retaurants and it is wonderful, much better than the beef or the pork.
reviews.title: nice very clean resort

reviews.text: Punta Cana itself holds no cultural interest and you will not find anything worth seeing nearby outside the hotel. This is a sun, sand and beach experience. Good sailing due to the omnipresent sea breeze (wonderful).
reviews.title: family fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: been to this resort twice first time as a family vacation loved it so much brought more family back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel..Great Price...Long Detailed Review! Must Read Through!
Tried it, but won't go back
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at Caribe Club Princess from Dec 7-10th. We were looking for a fun and rather inexpensive long weekend getaway and we definitely had fun.

reviews.title: Hoorible Hotel Experience
reviews.text: ARRIVAL - Upon arrival, we were immediately helped, but were told that our room was not ready (12:30PM). We were told to leave our luggage, go have lunch, and come back in an hour. We returned and were given our keys. When we went to the room, housekeeping was cleaning it still.

reviews.title: pleasantly surprised!
reviews.text: GROUNDS - We decided to tour the resort - our initial impression was that the grounds were well-kept, with more of the natural landscaping than others in the Punta Cana area, and a lot of very exotic-looking birds calmly walking around. Multiple pools mean no waiting and no overcrowdedness, but I was surprised by the lack of pool cleanliness. There is a lot of dirt on the walls and floor of the pool that is noticeable. Public bathrooms are also pretty gross - we just kept going back to the room instead.

reviews.title: Fun time!
reviews.text: FOOD - We visited the buffet - definitely lots of choices, but as we experienced at lunch and during the following dinners, the food quality is not high. Seafood dishes are "fishy" smelling and tasting, red meat is fatty, and general appearance or types of dishes are not that appetizing. My friend and I are both very adventurous eaters, so we tried almost everything and at most meals, we ended up sticking to mashed potatoes, pizza, french fries, pasta, and salads as these items tasted the best. Sad to say, we did waste some food but it really was inedible. Breakfast was pretty good - made to order items are delicious. Everything else is cold (all three days). Croissants and waffles are delicious! We also visited the Mexican and Chinese restaurants. The Mexican had fantastic soup and entrees, but the appetizers/salads/dessert were poor. The chinese was awful - everything was cooked and flavored with an abundance of soy sauce. We had 4 different entrees - they all tasted the same. DO NOT GO THERE! The creperie was nice, but not as good as the reviews of others suggested. THE BIGGEST PLUS - Both my fellow travelers and I got stomach sickness the last 2 visits to the DR. We were not sick at all from this resort - they do an excellent job of making sure that you are protected from bacteria, etc.

reviews.title: Great time at the CCP
reviews.text: BAR - unbelievably nice bartenders, very quick to get a drink - you can get champagne all day long which is nice, although not until after 12:30PM, so that leaves out mimosas at breakfast. Beer is Presidente which is great. Chocoloco is a phenomenal concoction! Either way, bartenders will make you any drink you want, shots are available if you want to do them, etc. No top shelf unless VIP, but I don't think anyone we met really missed it.

reviews.title: fantastic vacation
reviews.text: This was our second time at the caribe club and it was a great time again. We stayed 10/7/07-10/14/07. We lucked out, weather was great. We really enjoy this resort and like the lay out of the rooms. Rooms are close to all pools and the beach. All the specialty resturants and buffet are near the rooms and not up by the lobby. This hotel does not put a limit on the specialty resturants so we were able to get a reservation every night, including the day we arrived. We have stayed at much more expensive ai and have been limited to only 3 times for a 7 night stay. We enjoyed the food at every resturant.

reviews.title: Not bad at all!
reviews.text: The pools, beach and grounds are very beautiful. Great service every where from the front desk, buffet staff, and bartenders.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did do one excursion. The half day
reviews.title: Beach was nice

reviews.text: Outback Safari. Perfect amount of time off resort and a very informative and enjoyable excursion. We also went to the market down the beach and the plaza down the road.
reviews.title: Definitely Not The Best Resort Out There!

reviews.text: This is our 8th all inclusive and I would rate it as 5 star and definetly would return for a 3rd time.
reviews.title: Great Girls' Getaway!

reviews.text: I stayed with my family at Caribe Club Princess first week of December of 2007. I traveled with my husband (we are both 28), our 3 year old son and a couple in their 40s. We were tight on the budget and were not planning a vacation last year, however when I saw the Carible Club Princess deal I jumped on it with no hesitation. We arrived at the hotel from the airport few minutes after noon and were told that the room will be rady at 3:00. We decided to grab something to drink, I ordered pinacoladas and mohitos at the lobby bar, they were the worst drinks I have ever tasted. Both drinks were not made with fresh fuits and mint, but some artificial green syrup. Finally at three we went to get our room key, we were supposed to pick it up at the entranceto one of the hotel buildings. It took us 20 minutes in line, were all we were breathing was sewer, it was discusting.
reviews.title: not worth the money, stay away

reviews.text: Our room was ok, nothing special, just a standard hotel room, bathroom was ok too. There was iron, hair dryer and remote control in the room. If you want to use the safe, you need to ask for a key at the front desk during check-in, and they are going to charge you around $25 during your check out.
reviews.title: Don't eat anything!!!!

reviews.text: food: we went to two specialty restaurants, chinese and italian. Italian was good, the desert was delicious!, the chinese however, was really bad, but the desert was excellent if you like fried ice cream, if yougo there for the food you will be really disappointed, if you like fried ice cream then I recommend it highly. After these two we decided to try the main buffet for dinner and it was not bad at all. The food was exactly the same as at the specialty restaurants becasue they have a different theeme night every day, one day its mexican food, then italian, chinese and so on. There was something for everybody, the desers were good also.
reviews.title: Loved it !! :)
Bug Bites!
reviews.text: Drinks and Bars: bad, bad, bad no matter how much you tip. they might give you more alcohol but the way they mix the drinks is horrible. Pinacolatas were bad, mohitos, mamahuanas, miami vice, cosmo, dirty monkey, it did not matter what you ordered, I asked them for a slumer after everything else failed, they did not even know what it was ?! so if you are a drinker bring your own alcohol or stay away

reviews.title: They lie
reviews.text: Entertainment: bad, unprofessional, silly shows. The evening entertainment at the theater was not good. Very amateur, bed costumes, bad jokes , bad music. I love to attend these evening events and this was the first hotel that I did not like and first hotel that did not have a Michale Jackson show

reviews.title: Perfect place
reviews.text: If u want to have a rest, relax and enjoy ur holiday, u’ll like this hotel for sure!!! This is the best place I’ve ever visited. The hotel is very clean, marvelous and huge! The beach is fantastic! The animation team is very active, friendly and cute! Night shows are so wonderful! They really do all their best to make guest’s holiday interesting! Disco is perfect! Music is cute and a lot of people from other hotels come to it so it is always full! U won't feel boring :) I even can’t say the bad side of the hotel! I promise u will be satisfied! If u have questions, ask me, I’ll be happy to help u. (milang15@hotmail.com)

Six of us stayed at the Caribe Princess for one week and had a fantastic trip. As you arrive the staff was very friendly, the lobby is incredible and the grounds were beautiful. Our rooms were very clean, large and the fridge stocked with water and coke. We did run out of towels one day but had them about 2 hours later. We ate at the buffet often, there is a lot of selection, plenty of fresh fruits, breads and several main courses to choose from. We ate the Mexican (the best, have the steak), the Italian (a close second), the Chinese (I loved the lobster pieces) and the Brazilian (great if you are a meat eater). The staff is great and we left a dollar or two tip at each restaurant.
reviews.title: Fantastic vacation

likes.liked: — The rooms were clean, beds comfy, staff was friendly, beach is amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The evening entertainment was ok, the sound is really loud and there is about a 10 min wait between the intro and the main event.
reviews.title: If you want to held hostage this is the place, dirty beyond your dreams

likes.disliked: — Room dirty, staff was horrible, stayed one day and left, would rate this a -10 if possible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did some shopping, there is a large selection of goods to be found on the beach. To the left is about a 15 min walk and to the right is a 30 min walk. Both are filled with vendors eager to show you around. Haggle a bit but remember these people have to make a living as well so pay what you feel is fair. We purchased 2 paintings; one for $10.00 and the other for $7, so shop around and don't be shy. Also, I got a great deal on a Lacoste t-shirt, so have fun shopping. Don't forget your $20.00 departure tax and enjoy!
reviews.title: Worth every penny

likes.liked: — Beach and resort were clean and beautiful. Staff and service excellent.
likes.disliked: — Noisy pool loud speakers and noise after 11pm from show behind buffet

reviews.text: I would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Practically Perfect

likes.liked: — convenient resort layout, deep and wide beach, casual
likes.disliked: — would have like the beds placed along the opposite wall for the sunrise

reviews.title: wedding to remember
reviews.text: Came here with a group of 23, mainly from the Detroit area. My wife has always wanted a beach wedding, and she wasnt disappointed. We were married on the beach, in an open sided gazeebo, with many on-lookers. Chairs were all wrapped in white covers, and there was champaign for the group when the ceremony was finished. Photographer was great!! Afterwards, we had a beach reception with DJ, dance floor, full bar, and a buffet style dinner. Wait staff was awesome, and even convinced a few to loosen up their ties and have a little fun with us.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort was big and beautifull, with lots of parakeets and other animals we don't see in michigan..lol. Everyone was very freindly, and very layed back. If theres a problem with your room, call the front desk and go grab a drink, it might take a while, but someone will show. Even though tipping is included......TIP!! Don't be a cheapskate!! Throw a few bucks here and there, and you'll be remembered. Also, most can speak some english, but its appreciated to try a little spanish while communicating, it shows that your trying. Kelvin, the evening bartender at the back bar, is the man. We actually had so much fun with him, I requested to his boss, and the resort manager, to have Kelvin do my translation for the wedding and be our private bartender.
reviews.title: Great Resort.....just some minor changes needed.

reviews.text: The all the restraunts were very good, we had our rehersal dinner at The Pilon, which is Dominican style...The Dominican Flaf is highly recommended. Overall, this place was alot of fun and the staff was great. The only problem we had, on wed night, it seemed the resort was overtaken by Puerto Ricans, who were very noisy and disrespectfull to those around. Maybe this is the something the resort might be looking into. But I would definitly recomend Caribe Club
reviews.title: Don't Do It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from our trip to D.R. It was my first trip to a Non-english speaking country so I had prepared myself for an adventure. Overall my fiancee and I had an absolutely wonderful time. The service was great, the drinks were good (Im not much of a drinker so it was mostly wine and a rum tonic or as they say ron tonic for me) and the disco was really fun as well. The property in my opinion is bigger than most. I think they were going for a more tropical feel and I think they did a good job. They had many different animals around the property like peacocks, ducks, woodpeckers, swallows and many different types of fish. It is a huge property but they do provide a little shuttle service that runs a route on the resort that will take you to the reception area from your room or you could choose to walk through the mangroves for a scenic route that took us about 5-10 mins. because my fiancee kept stopping.
reviews.title: Had a FEW drawbacks, but overall, this place is SWEEEEETTT!

likes.liked: — Location, resort set up, BEACH BEACH BEACH

reviews.text: To maximize your stay I would suggest a couple of things,
reviews.title: Stay some where else!

reviews.text: Ok, we went with a group of 25 aged 24-34 from april 15-20. I planned the trip back in November and have been reading this site every week since then and stressing myself out that everyone would hate the place and be mad at me. I mean the review about being trapped....I was terrified about what I had gotten everyone into!
reviews.title: Fun - If 25 people all liked it then what more can I say?!

likes.liked: — It felt like a community, very nice landscaping and everything was in a great location.
likes.disliked: — Sometimes the PA system was just too loud, but that might be my fault for being hungover.

reviews.title: Nothing to worry about
reviews.text: Well, forget about it! Sure we can all be picky and complian that we had to wait for towels one day at the beach, but the sun is so warm and inviting you can dry off while taking a walk to the flea market or joining in a game of volleyball, or sit at the beach bar and enjoy a Presidente!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bottom line is all that worrying I did for 5 months about if all my friends would have fun was a waste of my time, I should have been thinking about how much fun we would all have instead!
reviews.title: Will never return nor recommend to any Couple!

likes.liked: — One of the pools, as it was the quietest and least busiest spot on the premises

reviews.text: I am a very compulsive Type A person so let me try and do what others have done to break down our vacation.
reviews.title: Extremely Fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival - Checked in at the lobbey, make sure to ask for the safe key so you dont have to make another trip once you get to the room, it was $18. After you get your room info, walk across the lobbey to the bar and order your first official Caribe Club Princess drink....you are now on vacation! They have a shuttle you can take to your room, but the walk is not bad.
reviews.title: Excellent Vacation!

likes.liked: — Holding hands at night, strolling, smelling, listening, gazing...

aka: Caribe Club Princess Beach Resort And Spa
description: Situated on one of the most beautiful beaches of the Dominican Republic, in an area where the beauty of the countryside and the delightful crystalline water, combined with fine and delicate sand, leave visitors with a strong feeling of pleasure and an exceptional sensation of relaxation and peace. Feelings which reveal never-ending possibilities as we stay in one of the marvellous Royal Suites, or allow ourselves to be seduced by the charming Honeymoon Suites, all of which include every convenience.The full top-quality service in the Caribe Suites and the Superior Rooms provides the perfect complement to the various leisure and entertainment activities available day and night (top quality food in the restaurants, a variety of beach and poolside activities,water sports, Children's and Teenagers' Clubs, Gran Casino (in the Bavaro Princess, with free transport...), the perfect holiday in a location of incomparable beauty.
